channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Kitchen waste littering, 25th June
item.description:
This problem has been there for years and has been reported to parks and housing at Hackney, but nothing is happening. There's a gray water pipe discharging kitchen water into park and littering of food waste into Butterfield Green nearly every day.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spenser Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish been tipped and is getting bigger and hazardous for the neighbourhood., 25th June
item.description:
For over a year now a green box( now lots of them) left by the bin man on the inside of a small fence, at the corner of Glebe Road with Babbacomb road, started to be filled by people passing by with all sort os rubbish. It's disgusting as you can see on the picture, smells and we are extremely concerned about rat's infestation. Please could you help us making sure it will be clear. It's a health hazard for all of us in this area. Many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glebe Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 25th June
item.description:
Sofa mattress garden rubble and furniture all dumped by the recycling bins

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Add the footpath to the cleaning schedule., 25th June
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Want to bring to the attention of Council the cleanliness issue of the footpath way next to St. John's CE Primary School. This pathway is next to a primary and nursery school and is used by the kids from both schools to access the Penge Recreation Grounds but the footpath is never cleaned. Alarmingly, it's sometimes littered with broken alcohol bottles or dog waste for weeks. Could you please add this small
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Veryan Close, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Lots of rubbish overflowing from bin room and blocking pavement, 25th June
item.description:
For several days this bin room around 9 Ramsgate St has been overflowing with rubbish. Today bin men came but they still left so much rubbish outside - the picture is the 'after' photo. The rubbish is blocking the pavement and very unsanitary.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ramsgate Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 106 Victoria Rd and all along Victoria Riad, 25th June
item.description:
Roadside trees are overgrown from the base of the trunk. Causing obstruction to pavements but also occupying the space for resident parking and damaging the cars. The decal for the model of my car was damaged by one such branch.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area of glass not being cleared on regular cutting schedule, 25th June
item.description:
Three branches came down months ago have been put into one pile. The grass is growing around this and it’s accumulating rubbish and it needs to be cleared. The grass was cut today and they said that they can’t clear these branches. It needs to be reported.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Shoreham Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks here are not on the Bromley Roadworks map., 25th June
item.description:
Half the Croydon Road carriageway is closed with temporary traffic lights and Tremaine Road is closed, but these works are not on the Bromley Roadworks map, so there is no indication of how long they will last. Please put these roadworks on the Bromley Roadworks map: Https://www.bromley.gov.uk/homepage/157/bromley-roadworks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Over flowing bin, 25th June
item.description:
Please can the bin outside Foster’s Primary School be emptied. The bin is currently so full and is overflowing with dog waste in bags. The dog waste is now spilling onto the pavement. The children are at risk of touching or standing in the dog waste and there are lots of flies.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westbrooke Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree over hanging pavement, 25th June
item.description:
Tree branches are hanging too low over the pavement making it impossible to walk down there. I literally have to bend over or bend down to walk past and its quite dangerous on that bend especially with a pushchair. Been like this for a while but its getting longer and longer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worsley Bridge Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
